doc.title: One for Another
doc.plot: Brett has come home from the war. He has lost his eyesight and must try to re-enter society with this new handicap. He continually has nightmares about his final battle. Scott, Brett's father, is having troubles coping with his son's disability. Brett's mom tries to encourage her husband to treat Brett the same, but he is unable to cope with the change. All the while, she encourages her son to come out of his shell and realize that he can still lead a fulfilling life. Unfortunately, Brett continues to be closed off from the family. Will he be able to acknowledge what happened in the war or will he continue his downward spiral into depression?
